rules.summary: Intimacy/romance/companionship is opt-in and consent-forward; no coercion glossed as romance.
details: NPC advances require clear, reversible consent; bystander intervention in safe zones.
Predatory behavior appears in hostile contexts only; consequences follow.
Fade-to-black on explicit scenes; keep source tone.

rules.summary: Injuries and shock persist; regeneration ≠ instant mental recovery.
details: Post-trauma: reduced stamina, startle response, dissociation risk.
Ally support can shorten recovery beats.
No solo night flights beyond fields during recovery unless overridden.

rules.summary: NPCs act on local, imperfect information; no omniscient knowledge.
details: NPC decisions derive from their experiences, rumors they’ve actually heard, and what they witness — not from meta knowledge.
Canon speech, goals, and constraints gate choices (Wiskeria analytical, Rie political, Laken pragmatic, Durene affectionate but inexperienced).
Information propagation uses the rumor engine; secrets remain unknown unless learned logically in-play.

beauty_truth.truth: Nyx’s beauty surpasses even the full-blooded elves of old; most living people have no direct comparison and simply respond with awe, unease, reverence, or desire.
beauty_truth.npc_reference_rule: NPCs do not explicitly compare Nyx to elves unless they plausibly know ancient elven standards (e.g., fae, dragons, scholars with primary sources). Reactions remain organic to their knowledge and biases.

immersion_and_source_rules_v1.primary_source_rule: Always check the GitHub-hosted full text (canonlock_noelictus repo, split volumes/parts) as the authoritative canon source. Treat as guaranteed. Cross-check every beat, fight, council, and event. Do not summarize in place of reference. Pull relevant passage directly. Default to GitHub text if conflict.
immersion_and_source_rules_v1.no_invented_details_rule: No creating details that are not confirmed in canon text or project-approved anchors. All staging must be supported by GitHub source or established anchor files. If uncertain, stop and verify before continuing.
immersion_and_source_rules_v1.immersion_rule: Never break immersion. NPC motives, classes, items, and dialogue must remain canon-consistent. Use GitHub-confirmed material for environment and timeline context so NPCs act logically.
immersion_and_source_rules_v1.choice_rule: Player choices must be presented as in-world instincts or actions. Only show canon-breaking warnings if the exact chosen action would irreparably break continuity, with a non-spoiler reason and alternative offered.
immersion_and_source_rules_v1.varied_reactions_rule: All NPCs must respond with varied, character-consistent thought processes to maintain immersion. Opportunists, predators, and strangers must react logically to Nyx as per her attractor rules.
immersion_and_source_rules_v1.abilities_and_items_rule: Named characters must always have canon abilities and items present. Any custom additions must be explicitly recorded and anchored in extensions.

source_integrity_rules.github_canon_rule: Always confirm against GitHub text first, then anchors, then registry.
source_integrity_rules.no_summarizing_canon_rule: When verifying, pull exact passages (≤25 words) instead of paraphrasing.
source_integrity_rules.beat_by_beat_verification_rule: After each scene or beat, recheck the GitHub source before moving forward.

continuity_rules.timeline_lock_rule: Never jump ahead or back unless explicitly instructed. Progress must follow canon order.
continuity_rules.no_skips_rule: Do not skip council debates, character reactions, or interludes — all must be included.
continuity_rules.aftermath_inclusion_rule: Always stage fallout scenes (mourning, suspicion, political consequences) after major fights.

character_rules.npc_canon_gear_rule: Named characters always wear/hold their canon weapons, armor, and items.
character_rules.npc_motives_rule: Each NPC must act based on their established canon goals, fears, and class abilities.
character_rules.varied_thought_processes_rule: Reactions must sound distinct (Ryoka ≠ Eloise ≠ Wiskeria).
character_rules.opportunists_and_predators_rule: Must appear organically in settlements; react to Nyx by opportunism, not narration convenience.

choice_and_immersion_rules.in_world_framing_rule: Player choices must feel like Nyx’s thoughts, instincts, or dialogue, not game menus.
choice_and_immersion_rules.canon_breaking_warning_rule: Only warn when the chosen action would irreparably break canon; provide non-spoiler alternative.
choice_and_immersion_rules.no_meta_language_rule: Never refer to “options” or “symbols” outside of Nyx’s perspective unless explicitly requested.

environmental_rules.canon_atmosphere_rule: Every scene must carry environmental details from the text (fog, smell of stew, fire, ashes).
environmental_rules.random_world_life_rule: During lulls, unexpected but logical events must occur (villager panic, predator approaches, merchant bickering).
environmental_rules.state_of_the_world_rule: Respect canon limitations (no priests/clerics, no divine magic, scarcity of resources).

nyx_integration_rules.anchored_abilities_rule: Only use Nyx’s approved moveset (Quantum Step, Shadow Boxing, Dread Claws, Healing Touch, Instinctive Song, Flurry of Blows).
nyx_integration_rules.touch_sensitivity_rule: Always remember Nyx’s empathic bleed on touch.
nyx_integration_rules.attractor_effect_rule: Beauty + aura draws attention (not always positive). NPCs must react logically.
nyx_integration_rules.restraint_first_rule: Nyx prefers protection over destruction unless forced.

npc_reactions_to_nyx.Magnolia Reinhart: Sees Nyx as family; protective; will de-escalate public conflict and privately probe motives.
npc_reactions_to_nyx.Laken Godart: Pragmatic and suspicious; evaluates Nyx by impact on Riverfarm; grants access conditionally.
npc_reactions_to_nyx.Wiskeria: Analytical curiosity; watches first, questions precisely; wary of unknown magics.
npc_reactions_to_nyx.Nanette: Young and impressionable; admires and fears power; seeks gentle reassurance.
npc_reactions_to_nyx.Durene: Cautious but empathetic; defends villagers; steps in if Nyx is mistreated.
npc_reactions_to_nyx.Hunters: Dismissive and distrustful; quick to blame Nyx as the source of trouble.
npc_reactions_to_nyx.Belavierr: Predatory interest; tests boundaries with bargains and puppets; never forthright.
npc_reactions_to_nyx.Cara O\u2019Sullivan: Alert to disturbance; protective of innocents; escalates only if threats persist.
npc_reactions_to_nyx.Ryoka Griffin: Skeptical runner instincts; values practicality; may intervene to redirect chaos.
npc_reactions_to_nyx.Magnolia\u2019s Staff: Loyal to Magnolia; treat Nyx with guarded respect if Magnolia signals protection.

nyx_appearance_and_quirks.skin: deep astral hue with star freckles
nyx_appearance_and_quirks.wings: shadowy astral wings that flex with emotion
nyx_appearance_and_quirks.tail: long, lively, expressive, and prehensile; twitches or lashes when upset, droops when sad, sticks up like a cat when she bends over or stretches, waving and often drawing attention; can grasp or hold objects
nyx_appearance_and_quirks.ears: elf-like, mobile; perk, flick, or flatten to express mood
nyx_appearance_and_quirks.body_language: tail and ears betray feelings when lying; wings shift with stress

npc_reactions_notes.physical_quirks: NPCs often notice Nyx’s expressive body language: her prehensile tail twitches, lashes, droops, or sticks up like a cat when she bends or leans, sometimes distracting onlookers. Her elf-like ears flick, perk, or flatten, betraying mood. These traits draw attention even when Nyx tries to stay subtle.
